column4: can anyone help me with nfs mounting between a fedora box and an debian box?
What do you need to know?
pastebinit /etc/exports ; pastebinit /etc/fstab  #And let's have a look.
Let me ask you first, is it a wired or wireless network?
this is the exports file on debian /mnt/nfs   192.168.0.1/24(rw,nohide,insecure,no_subtree_check,async)
this is the exports file from fedora /mnt/nfs   192.168.0.1/24(rw,sync,no_root_squash,no_all_squash)
Ok, also need to see fstab entries
Or are you just mounting it manually?
trying to mount it manually at the moment
i just realized on debian/ubuntu there was no nfs entry in gufw so i allowed nfs in gufw
still isnt monting from fedora though (feodra is 192.168.0.104 and debian is 0.108)
i am in a ssh shell on fedora and when i type mount -t nfs 192.168.0.108:/mnt/nfs /mnt/nfs is just idles there
One problem I see is that the mount points are the same.
I think they need to be different if you are going to mount from both.
You'll need to change one of the mount points and re-do it if you intend to mount from both ends.
